text: well centers mission is to promote the
growth development and independence of
people with disabilities through
programs of therapy education and work
opportunity the challenges for people
with disabilities are myriad and they
are as unique as the individuals for
children it could be speech or language
or motor skills for adults its job skill
building for me as I think of it I have
a daughter that's 25 years old that's on
the autism spectrum and honestly I think
one of the greatest barriers is this
idea that I can engage and I can
contribute because people don't invite
me in I see all of these things that
block my path forward so one of our
biggest responsibilities is to help
unblock that barrier and allow them to
engage and contribute the AWS deep lens
inclusivity challenge is asking
developers to consider how their
technology can open the doors for people
with disabilities for example someone
that's visually impaired is going to
have a need for the technology to unlock
that bit those barriers in a fashion
that's different than someone that is
hearing-impaired or different from
someone that suffers from autism the
other piece to think about is then age
so a child that's in school that's
trying to learn to read I'm looking
forward to the submissions that help
kind of gamify that make it fun the
easier it is for them to engage with the
technology the more successful that
technology is going to be in driving
that end state that that individual is
searching for so now Amazon's allowing
us to work with them to unleash the
talents of all of these developers
through technology to make the world a
more inclusive world I don't think it
gets any more exciting than that
[Music]
